content.question: The function <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is defined by <math alttext="f of x equals, 1 plus 9 x, plus 3 x squared, minus x cubed" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>9</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>. On what open interval is <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> increasing at a decreasing rate?

choices.label: <math alttext="open parenthesis, negative infinity comma negative 1, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>∞</mi></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, negative 1 comma 1, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> only

<math alttext="open parenthesis, negative 1 comma 3, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, 1 comma 3, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> only

content.answer: <math alttext="open parenthesis, 1 comma 3, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> only

topic.text: 5.8: Sketching Graphs of Functions and Their Derivatives

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
